author: Reuters Editorial
title: April services edges up to 54.8
text:
BEIJING, April 30 services industry picked up in April, an official survey showed on Monday, as the sector extended a solid run of strong activity.
The official non-manufacturing Purchasing rose to 54.8 from 54.6 in March.
The services sector accounts for over half of China’s economy, with rising wages giving Chinese consumers more spending power.
The composite PMI covering both manufacturing and services activity rose to 54.1 in April, from March’s 54, well above the 50-mark that separates expansion from contraction. (Reporting Miller Editing by Shri Navaratnam)
